title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Thu Mar 1, 2018 | 3:50pm EST Editors Choice Pictures 
Participants wearing motorcycle helmet are sprayed with firecrackers during the Beehive Firecrackers festival at the Yanshui district, in Tainan, Taiwan. REUTERS/Tyrone Siu Reuters / Thursday, March 01, 2018 Participants wearing motorcycle helmet are sprayed with firecrackers during the Beehive Firecrackers festival at the Yanshui district, in Tainan, Taiwan. REUTERS/Tyrone Siu Close 1 / 24 
People attend a blessing ceremony with their AR-15-style rifles at the Sanctuary Church in Newfoundland, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 People attend a blessing ceremony with their AR-15-style rifles at the Sanctuary Church in Newfoundland, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz Close 2 / 24 
A Hindu devotee, smeared in colored powder, rests on a road during a procession for Holi celebrations in Kolkata, India. REUTERS/Rupak De Chowdhuri Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 A Hindu devotee, smeared in colored powder, rests on a road during a procession for Holi celebrations in Kolkata, India. REUTERS/Rupak De Chowdhuri Close 3 / 24 
Britain's Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge and Prince Harry's fiancee Meghan Markle attend the first annual Royal Foundation Forum held at Aviva in London. REUTERS/Chris Jackson/Pool Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Britain's Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge and Prince Harry's fiancee Meghan Markle attend the first annual Royal Foundation Forum held at Aviva in London. REUTERS/Chris Jackson/Pool Close 4 / 24 
A college student smears a friend with colored powder during Holi celebrations in Agartala, India. REUTERS/Jayanta Dey Reuters / Thursday, March 01, 2018 A college student smears a friend with colored powder during Holi celebrations in Agartala, India. REUTERS/Jayanta Dey Close 5 / 24 
Buddhist monks attend a ceremony on Makha Bucha Day at Wat Phra Dhammakaya in Pathum Thani, Thailand. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Buddhist monks attend a ceremony on Makha Bucha Day at Wat Phra Dhammakaya in Pathum Thani, Thailand. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Close 6 / 24 
People with their AR-15-style rifles attend a blessing ceremony at the Sanctuary Church in Newfoundland, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 People with their AR-15-style rifles attend a blessing ceremony at the Sanctuary Church in Newfoundland, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz Close 7 / 24 
Students arrive at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School for the first time since the mass shooting in Parkland, Florida. REUTERS/Mary Beth Koeth Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Students arrive at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School for the first time since the mass shooting in Parkland, Florida. REUTERS/Mary Beth Koeth Close 8 / 24 
Members of the public visit the late U.S. evangelist Billy Graham as he lies in honor in the Rotunda of the U.S. Capitol in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Members of the public visit the late U.S. evangelist Billy Graham as he lies in honor in the Rotunda of the U.S. Capitol in Washington. REUTERS/Leah Millis Close 9 / 24 
Rescue workers look at the wreckage after a train crash in Kom Hamada in the northern province of Beheira, Egypt. REUTERS/Mohamed Abd El Ghany Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Rescue workers look at the wreckage after a train crash in Kom Hamada in the northern province of Beheira, Egypt. REUTERS/Mohamed Abd El Ghany Close 
Deer clash antlers as snow falls in Richmond Park in London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Deer clash antlers as snow falls in Richmond Park in London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close 11 / 24 
An Ultra-Orthodox Jewish boy dressed in a costume takes part in the reading from the Book of Esther, a ceremony performed on the Jewish holiday of Purim, in a synagogue in Ashdod, Israel. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 An Ultra-Orthodox Jewish boy dressed in a costume takes part in the reading from the Book of Esther, a ceremony performed on the Jewish holiday of Purim, in a synagogue in Ashdod, Israel. REUTERS/Amir Cohen Close 
Former Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort departs from U.S. District Court in Washington. REUTERS/Yuri Gripas Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Former Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort departs from U.S. District Court in Washington. REUTERS/Yuri Gripas Close 13 / 24 
A couple wearing bullet crowns sit with their AR-15-style rifles in their cases, as people attend a blessing ceremony at the Sanctuary Church in Newfoundland, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 A couple wearing bullet crowns sit with their AR-15-style rifles in their cases, as people attend a blessing ceremony at the Sanctuary Church in Newfoundland, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz Close 14 / 24 
A fan of Bollywood actress Sridevi is pushed by a policeman as he waits with others to offer condolences outside a makeshift memorial in Mumbai, India. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 A fan of Bollywood actress Sridevi is pushed by a policeman as he waits with others to offer condolences outside a makeshift memorial in Mumbai, India. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui Close 15 / 24 
A window with frost pattern is pictured on top of the highest German mountain, the Zugspitze, in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany. REUTERS/Michaela Rehle Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 A window with frost pattern is pictured on top of the highest German mountain, the Zugspitze, in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany. REUTERS/Michaela Rehle Close 16 / 24 
The Soyuz MS-06 capsule carrying the crew of Joe Acaba and Mark Vande Hei of the U.S., and Alexander Misurkin of Russia descends beneath a parachute just before landing in a remote area outside the town of Dzhezkazgan (Zhezkazgan), Kazakhstan.... more Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 The Soyuz MS-06 capsule carrying the crew of Joe Acaba and Mark Vande Hei of the U.S., and Alexander Misurkin of Russia descends beneath a parachute just before landing in a remote area outside the town of Dzhezkazgan (Zhezkazgan), Kazakhstan. REUTERS/Alexander Nemenov/Pool Close 17 / 24 
School students hold paper fans featuring the mascot for the Tokyo 2020 Olympics and Paralympics after Tokyo Olympics organizers unveiled the mascots selected by popular vote by elementary students across Japan at the Hoyonomori Gakuen School in... more Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 School students hold paper fans featuring the mascot for the Tokyo 2020 Olympics and Paralympics after Tokyo Olympics organizers unveiled the mascots selected by popular vote by elementary students across Japan at the Hoyonomori Gakuen School in Tokyo. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Close 18 / 24 
A man runs through the snow with his husky dog at the Phoenix Park in Dublin, Ireland. REUTERS/Clodagh Kilcoyne Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 A man runs through the snow with his husky dog at the Phoenix Park in Dublin, Ireland. REUTERS/Clodagh Kilcoyne Close 19 / 24 
A general view of the Edicule of the Tomb at the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem's Old City. Picture taken with a fish-eye lens. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 A general view of the Edicule of the Tomb at the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem's Old City. Picture taken with a fish-eye lens. REUTERS/Ammar Awad Close 20 / 24 
Warren Orlandi and Pauly Phillips display their rings after they became the first same-sex couple to marry atop of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, just two days out from the 40th anniversary of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, in Australia.... more Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Warren Orlandi and Pauly Phillips display their rings after they became the first same-sex couple to marry atop of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, just two days out from the 40th anniversary of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, in Australia. REUTERS/David Gray Close 21 / 24 
Pigeons are seen as ice partially covers the fountain of the Counts of Egmont and Hornes on a cold winter day in central Brussels, Belgium. REUTERS/Francois Lenoir Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Pigeons are seen as ice partially covers the fountain of the Counts of Egmont and Hornes on a cold winter day in central Brussels, Belgium. REUTERS/Francois Lenoir Close 22 / 24 
Views of installations at the "David Bowie is" exhibition are seen during a press preview at the Brooklyn Museum in Brooklyn, New York. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton Reuters / Wednesday, February 28, 2018 Views of installations at the "David Bowie is" exhibition are seen during a press preview at the Brooklyn Museum in Brooklyn, New York. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton Close 23 / 24 
Russian President Vladimir Putin addresses the Federal Assembly, including the State Duma parliamentarians, members of the Federation Council, regional governors and other high-ranking officials, in Moscow. REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov Reuters / Thursday, March 01, 2018 Russian President Vladimir Putin addresses the Federal Assembly, including the State Duma parliamentarians, members of the Federation Council, regional governors and other high-ranking officials, in Moscow. REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov Close
